Dot Carousel

The dots below the picture can be clicked to change the photo.


  
  <div class="carousel">
    <div class="carousel__slide fade">
      <img src="#">
    </div>
    <div class="carousel__slide fade">
      <img src="#">
    </div>
    <div class="carousel__slide fade">
      <img src="#">
    </div>
  </div>
  <br>
  <!-- Dots -->
  <div class="carousel__controls">
    <span class="dot" onclick="currentSlide(1)"></span>
    <span class="dot" onclick="currentSlide(2)"></span>
    <span class="dot" onclick="currentSlide(3)"></span>
  </div>

Automatic Carousel

This Carousel will automatically display the slides one at a time. 


  
  <div class="carousel--auto">
    <div class="carousel__slide fade">
      <img src="#">
    </div>
    <div class="carousel__slide fade">
      <img src="#">
    </div>
    <div class="carousel__slide fade">
      <img src="#">
    </div>
  </div>

Multi-image Carousel

This Carousel will automatically display multiple slides at a time, dependent on the value you place in the multiSlides() parameter, located in the JavaScript code. (Example: multiSlides(3) shows three images).


Note: Keeping the id in the correct order is necessary for the carousel to function properly.

  
    <div class="carousel--multi">
      <div id="0" class="carousel__slide">
          <img src="#">
      </div>
      <div id="1" class="carousel__slide">
          <img src="#">
      </div>
      <div id="2" class="carousel__slide">
        <img src="#">
      </div>
      <div id="3" class="carousel__slide">
        <img src="#">
      </div>
      <div id="4" class="carousel__slide">
        <img src="#">
      </div>
    </div>
